  • Method Details

    • makeCrackPath

      protected void makeCrackPath(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int direction, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle brickFace)
      Makes the crack from the point of impact to the side of the brick that is parallel to side where the ball made contact.

      Based on the point of impact, a random point is chosen on the other side of the brick to create a crack with.

      Example: If the ball hits the bottom side of the brick, a random point is selected on the upper side of the brick.. Then, a crack is made from the point of impact to the chosen random point on the upper side of the brick.

      Parameters:
      point - point of contact
      direction - direction of the crack to be made (vertical or horizontal)
      brickFace - the Shape object of the brick

    • makeCrackPath

      private void makeCrackPath(javafx.geometry.Point2D start, javafx.geometry.Point2D end)
      Chooses points inside the brick and then link them together to finally create the crack.

      Each of the point chosen has a probability to jump by an amount, making the crack seemingly random.

      Parameters:
      start - the starting point of the crack
      end - the ending point of the crack

    • checkIfOutOfBrickBound

      private double checkIfOutOfBrickBound(double y, javafx.geometry.Point2D start, javafx.geometry.Point2D end)
      It checks whether, when a point "jumps", it becomes out of bound from the brick or not.

      If it does becomes out of bound, it is immediately adjusted back into the brick.

      Parameters:
      y - the y-axis of the point in question (only the y-axis of the point has to jump out of bound)
      start - starting point of the crack
      end - ending point of the crack.
      Returns:
      returns the value itself back if it does not fall out of bound. Otherwise, return the adjusted value.

    • randomInBounds

      private int randomInBounds(int bound)
      Returns a random number between the range of -ve of the input number and +ve of the input number.
      Parameters:
      bound - the range of the number in question
      Returns:
      a random number between the range of the -ve of bound to +ve of bound

    • jumps

      private int jumps(int bound, double probability)
      Roll dice to whether allow a jump or not
      Parameters:
      bound - the range of the number to return if a jump does happen
      probability - probability of jumping
      Returns:
      theamount deviation of the point on the y-axis

    • makeRandomPoint

      private javafx.geometry.Point2D makeRandomPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D from, javafx.geometry.Point2D to, int direction)
      It chooses the random point on the other side of the brick from the side where the ball made contact.

      The corner of the sides is used to find the random point between them.

      Parameters:
      from - the first point on the edge of the side
      to - the last point on the edge of the side
      direction - direction of the crack
      Returns:
      the random point that is to be used as the end point of the crack

    • getCrackPath

      public javafx.scene.shape.Path getCrackPath()
      Gets the Path object used to describe the crack on the brick.
      Returns:
      the Path object of the crack
